3rd Party Memory Boards  

 

  

 

 

 

Magna Systems RAMcharger Boards

 

256K Board Front

256K Board Back

1MB Board Front

1MB Board Back

 

 

Magna Systems was a small company run out of Flushing Queens, New York in the mid 1980's.  It sold several versions of its RAMCharger products from the 256K and 1MB versions shown above and also a 512K version as well. It came with an On/Off switch for increased compatibility with programs that did not always run when the board was in the ON position, which enabled its 16K RAM/240-1008K RAMdisk modes.   When set to OFF it would run in only a 16K RAM mode.

 

The board received very good reviews when released and other versions for the XL/XE  & even the Atari ST line were advertised as follows:

 

RAMCHARGER
Magna Systems
147-05 Sanford Ave, Suite 4E
Flushing, NY 11355
(718) 339-0908
$299.95, 1Mb for Atari 800

ALSO AVAILABLE:
(All 8-bit upgrades include MYDOS)
$149.95, 256K for 800
$199.95, 512K for 800
$100-$120, 256K for 800XL/1200XL
$120, 320K for 130XE
$180, 576K for 130XE
$280, 1088K for 130XE
$135-$150, 1Mb for 520ST

 

The Atari 800 expansion is Axlon compatible. The XL and XE expansions are 130XE compatible. The ST expansion is, of course, compatible with the 1040ST. The XL, XE, and ST modifications required that you send your computer to the Magna Systems address for the modification to be installed.
